if.if: and( upper(b.ISBN13) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(b.book_name) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(c1.cat_name) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(b.book_price) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(s1.ISBN_cnt) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(c2.branch_name) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') )

and( upper(b.isbn13) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(b.book_name) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper((select cc.cat_name from code_category cc where cc.cat_cd=b.cat_cd)) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper(b.book_price) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper((select si.ISBN_cnt from stock_info si where b.ISBN13 = si.ISBN13)) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') or upper((select c.branch_name from code_branch c where c.branch_cd in(select bc.branch_cd from stock_info bc where bc.ISBN13 in(b.ISBN13)))) like upper('%${search_keyword}%') )
and upper((select cc.cat_name from code_category cc where cc.cat_cd=b.cat_cd)) like upper('%${search_keyword}%')
and upper((select c.branch_name from code_branch c where c.branch_cd in(select bc.branch_cd from stock_info bc where bc.ISBN13 in(b.ISBN13)))) like upper('%${search_keyword}%')

mapper.select: select cat_cd as "cat_cd" , cat_name as "cat_name" from code_category where 1=1
select size_cd as "size_cd" , size_name as "size_name" from code_book_size where 1=1
select branch_cd as "branch_cd" , branch_name as "branch_name" from code_branch where 1=1
select distinct publisher as "publisher" from book

select count(*) from( select b.isbn13 as "ISBN13" ,b.book_name as "BOOK_NAME" ,c1.cat_name as "CAT_NAME" ,b.book_price as "BOOK_PRICE" ,b.book_pages||'' as "BOOK_PAGES" ,b.writer as "WRITER" ,b.publisher as "PUBLISHER" ,b.size_cd||'' as "SIZE_CD" ,b.is_print as "IS_PRINT" ,b.emp_no||'' as "EMP_NO" ,to_char(b.published_dt,'YYYY-MM-DD') as "PUBLISHED_DT" ,b.editor as "EDITOR" ,s1.isbn_cnt as "ISBN_CNT" ,c2.branch_name as "BRANCH_NAME" ,b.reg_dt as "REG_DT" from book b inner join code_category c1 on b.cat_cd = c1.cat_cd inner join stock_info s1 on b.isbn13 = s1.isbn13 inner join code_branch c2 on s1.branch_cd = c2.branch_cd
where 1=1
and b.emp_no = '${emp_no}' )

select count(*) from( select w.*, e.emp_name, d.dep_name, cj.jikup, w.days_attended from work_days_mng w, employee e, dept d, code_jikup cj where w.emp_no=e.emp_no and e.dep_no=d.dep_no and e.jikup_cd=cj.jikup_cd
)
select e.emp_no as "emp_no" from employee e, work_days_mng w where e.emp_no = w.emp_no
mapper.insert: insert into warehousing_info values( (select nvl(max(wh_no), 0)+1 from warehousing_info) ,(select nvl(max(order_inven_no), 0) from books_inven_order_info) ,null )
mapper.select: select count(*) from emp_dayoff_apply where start_dayoff between TRUNC(sysdate,'MM') and LAST_DAY(sysdate) or end_dayoff between TRUNC(sysdate,'MM') and LAST_DAY(sysdate)
select remain_dayoff||'' as "remain_dayoff" ,dayoff_tot||'' as "dayoff_tot" from emp_dayoff_info where emp_no=#{emp_no}
select count(*) from emp_dayoff_apply where emp_no=#{emp_no} and dayoff_apply_dt between TRUNC(sysdate,'MM') and LAST_DAY(sysdate)
mapper.update: update emp_dayoff_info set dayoff_tot = dayoff_tot+#{using_dayoff} where emp_no=#{emp_no}
mapper.select: select dayoff_apply_no||'' from emp_dayoff_apply where 1=1 and emp_no=#{emp_no} and confirm='N' or confirm='n'

select d.dayoff_apply_no "dayoff_apply_no", d.emp_no "emp_no", (select e.emp_name from employee e where e.emp_no=(select ee.mgr_emp_no from employee ee where ee.emp_no = d.emp_no) ) "mgr_name", (select c.jikup from code_jikup c where jikup_cd=(select e.jikup_cd from employee e where e.emp_no=(select d.emp_no from emp_dayoff_apply d where d.dayoff_apply_no=#{dayoff_apply_no}) ) ) "jikup", (select e.emp_name from employee e where e.emp_no=(select d.emp_no from emp_dayoff_apply d where d.dayoff_apply_no=#{dayoff_apply_no}) ) "emp_name", d.dayoff_apply_dt "dayoff_apply_dt", (select c.dayoff_name from code_dayoff c where c.dayoff_cd = d.dayoff_cd) "dayoff_category", d.using_dayoff "using_dayoff", to_char(d.start_dayoff, 'yyyy-mm-dd') "start_dayoff", to_char(d.end_dayoff, 'yyyy-mm-dd') "end_dayoff", d.confirm "confirm" from emp_dayoff_apply d where 1=1 and d.dayoff_apply_no=#{dayoff_apply_no}
